title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE will be sold in India
description: Samsung is working on the Galaxy Tab S10 FE, a cheaper counterpart (or two) to the flagship Tab S10 line. The company itself slipped up last month and revealed this fact, and now we get another piece of the puzzle, albeit a very small one. The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) has certified the Galaxy Tab S10 FE's batteries for sale in the country, so clearly the Tab S10 FE will be offered in India. The dual battery system will come with model numbers EB-BX526ABE and EB-BX526ABY, respectively. Unfortunately, the certification doesn't reveal any details about Samsung's upcoming...
excerpt: There will seemingly be at least two of them. Samsung is working on the Galaxy Tab S10 FE, a cheaper counterpart (or two) to the flagship Tab S10 line. The...
text: Samsung is working on the Galaxy Tab S10 FE, a cheaper counterpart (or two) to the flagship Tab S10 line. The company itself slipped up last month and revealed this fact, and now we get another piece of the puzzle, albeit a very small one. The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) has certified the Galaxy Tab S10 FE's batteries for sale in the country, so clearly the Tab S10 FE will be offered in India. The dual battery system will come with model numbers EB-BX526ABE and EB-BX526ABY, respectively. Unfortunately, the certification doesn't reveal any details about Samsung's upcoming mid-range tablet, but the wording in Samsung's aforementioned slip-up implies there will be at least two of them as the reference is to the "Galaxy Tab S10 FE series". html:
Samsung is working on the Galaxy Tab S10 FE, a cheaper counterpart (or two) to the flagship Tab S10 line. The company itself slipped up last month and revealed this fact, and now we get another piece of the puzzle, albeit a very small one.

The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) has certified the Galaxy Tab S10 FE's batteries for sale in the country, so clearly the Tab S10 FE will be offered in India. The dual battery system will come with model numbers EB-BX526ABE and EB-BX526ABY, respectively.

Unfortunately, the certification doesn't reveal any details about Samsung's upcoming mid-range tablet, but the wording in Samsung's aforementioned slip-up implies there will be at least two of them as the reference is to the "Galaxy Tab S10 FE series".

Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 FE

The Galaxy Tab S9 FE and Galaxy Tab S9 FE+ were both launched in October of 2023, so it's definitely high time for a refresh. We'll let you know when we find out more.

Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 FE
